Не знаю как я обходил стороной эту игру столь долгое время, но тем не менее добрался.
Поиграв в Portal 2 я понял, что это теперь одно из моих любимых игр. Было очень приятно увидеть продолжение 1й части настолько переработанным и красивым. Я ожидал худшего, когда впервые запускал её. 
Игра обзавелась красивыми, интересными и сложными локациями. Она позволяет глубже понять и разобраться в лоре игры.
Невероятно харизмотичные персонажи запоминаются на долго. Их озвучка - это просто шикарно.
В игре присутствуют как спокойные, так и весьма динамичные и экшоновые моменты.
Однозначно рекомендую к покупке даже без скидки.
P.S: Забыл упомянуть кооператив и как следствие много карт от сообщества для прохождения с друзьями.

Lovely puzzles, amazing atmosphere in solo play. Note: the multiplayer storyline is completely different from single player (including the puzzles and surroundings). I recommend playing multiplayer before solo, though it doesn't matter.

ES: A pesar de que este juego es bastante antiguo, decidí comprarlo y no me arrepiento. La trama es muy emocionante, a todos les gustará. Y el modo cooperativo agregado agrega aún más diversión al juego. Si compras, no te arrepentirás.

EN: Yeah, game is old(2011), but I've bought it and I still like this game. This game's plot and story is amazing and everybody will like that. I bought it and didn't regret it and you will not too.

I feel like the usual cycle of games criticism goes:

a. Game is released; is reviewed as if it were the greatest thing ever bestowed upon man. 
b. Five years later; game is "good for what it was" but either has "aged badly," is "problematic," or both. 
c. Ten years later; the same reviewers who once thought it was the greatest thing ever now have either changed their mind or are in denial. 

This is all a long-winded way of saying that almost ten years after its release, Portal 2 is still a master-class in design. Its visual style has aged remarkably well -- perhaps from all the use of white. Its puzzles are tough but fair, and fill you with a sense of accomplishment that almost no game since has replicated (its closest modern analogue is Breath of the Wild, in my opinion). Its story and characters are full of empathy and heart, and if anything its cynicism about late capitalism seems ahead-of-its-time. J.K. Simmons and Stephen Merchant give two performances that still rank among the best voice work in the history of the medium. 

This is not the original Portal. That game can be finished in one sitting, if you persevere. This can stretch above ten hours, and even get close to 15 if you struggle with its many difficult puzzles. It is self-indulgent, for better or worse. But just because it stands in the shadow of a masterpiece, that does not make its shadow any smaller. It's a big-budget, high-selling game where no one shoots each other, drives, or scores touchdowns. That was rare when it came out, and it's even rarer now.
